intro: Alyxia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as oaks and elms. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Alyxia arfakensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
